image.altText: White smoke coming out of a metal chimney.

props.synopsis: Wood heaters are estimated to be responsible for more pollution-related deaths than all the cars on our roads. This national map shows which areas are affected the most.

title.children: Wood heater smoke a silent killer and Sydney tops the list

image.altText: A person holds a mobile phone in a darkened room. Graphic representation of dollar signs are emerging from the phone.

props.synopsis: It was a scam so simple it took just minutes on your phone, where you could tell the tax office how much money to pay you, and it came through within days.

title.children: How the ATO was fleeced for $2b by a scam so simple you could do it on your phone

image.altText: David Littleproud press conference with National Party leadership - 2025-05-20 13:03:02

props.synopsis: Nationals leader David Littleproud rejects suggestions predecessor Barnaby Joyce's push to drop Australia's net zero commitment is a sign of a partyroom revolt. Follow live.

title.children: Littleproud shrugs off Joyce's net zero challenge

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Littleproud denies Joyce's net zero push equates to partyroom revolt
Barnaby to introduce bill to repeal net zero
Tehan defends Israel's actions on Gazan aid

image.altText: A close up photo of Donald Trump speaking to reporters at a cabinet table.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump says Israel needs to "make a decision" about its next steps in Gaza, as more than 100 humanitarian agencies warn of mass starvation.

title.children: Trump says Gaza is a 'mess' as Israel denies starvation crisis

image.altText: Alex de Minaur puts his arm around Alejandro Davidovich Fokina after their Washington DC Open final.

props.synopsis: Australia's Alex de Minaur wins an epic Washington DC Open final against Alejandro Davidovich Fokina, claiming his 10th singles title 7-3 in the final-set tiebreak.

title.children: De Minaur's classy move after stopping Spaniard from winning first title

image.altText: Simon Stiell

props.synopsis: One of the world's top climate diplomats has urged the federal government to commit to an ambitious 2035 target to cut carbon emissions.

title.children: UN climate chief urges Australia to 'go big' on 2035 emissions target

image.altText: A man walking into court surrounded by journalists and TV cameramen.

props.synopsis: The star of hit Netflix series Wild Croc Territory, Matt Wright, has pleaded not guilty to attempting to pervert the course of justice ahead of a Supreme Court trial starting this week. It comes three years after a chopper accident which killed his co-star and close friend, Chris "Willow" Wilson.

title.children: Celebrity croc wrangler Matt Wright pleads not guilty ahead of Supreme Court trial

image.altText: Jane Dudley

props.synopsis: After 18 years with bipolar 1 disorder, an Australian woman's life has been changed by a poo transplant from her partner.

title.children: DIY poo transplant leads to 'miraculous' mental health change

image.altText: Teenage girl sits up in bed and blows nose

props.synopsis: We may use terms like cold and the flu as if they are the same thing, but there are some key differences between them.

title.children: What's the difference between the cold, flu and RSV?

image.altText: Outside the Western Sydney International Airport

props.synopsis: A former Western Sydney Airport executive procurement manager pleaded guilty to soliciting a corrupt commission after he attempted to invite a bribe from a company vying for a $5 million contract.

title.children: Western Sydney Airport official who sought $200k kickback narrowly avoids jail time

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: The US and EU agree to a deal that imposes a 15 per cent tariff on European imports, while the S&P 500 has hit its fifth record close in five days. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: US and EU seal trade deal, Wall St has fifth record close, ASX lifts

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Boss Energy melts down as sales and costs disappoint
ASX 200 opens higher, Boss Energy craters

image.altText: Ursula von der Leyen and Donald Trump sitting in a golf club meeting room.

props.synopsis: The deal, which sees European imports to the US levied a flat 15 per cent tariff, will affect a third of global trade.

title.children: US and European Union reach trade deal during Trump golf trip

image.altText: England bowler Ben Stokes holds out his hand to India batters Ravindra Jadeja and Washington Sundar during a Test.

props.synopsis: England and India's Test series is still alive heading into game five after the tourists batted out a draw at Old Trafford with three batters notching centuries, much to Ben Stokes's chagrin.

title.children: 'Farcical': England angered by India batter getting first Test ton in draw

image.altText: a drone shot of a town nestled between red rock ranges

props.synopsis: With no properties for rent in Kununurra and the median rental price now exceeding $700 per week, many prospective renters in the east Kimberley town are forced to house-sit or stay with friends.

title.children: WA town has no homes available but hundreds of people looking

image.altText: Damage along the front left of an aircraft named Virgin Australia

props.synopsis: A Virgin Australia plane becomes disconnected from a tug vehicle and collides into it at Tullamarine airport.

title.children: Virgin plane collides with tug vehicle at Melbourne Airport

image.altText: Landslide boulder at Great mackerel beach in Sydney's northern beaches

props.synopsis: In October 2020, a landslide cascaded down a slope in Sydney's Northern Beaches, sending down boulders that took out the side of the Kemp family's house.

title.children: A retirement dream house left to rot five years after Sydney landslide

image.altText: Ley and Albanese walk down the aisle in the senate chamber

props.synopsis: While the Liberals are showing signs they have not left the last election behind, Labor faces pressure from within to change its policy on Palestine.

title.children: Labor and Liberals facing internal fault lines as parliament resumes

image.altText: A composite image shows US President Donald Trump and China's Xi Jinping

props.synopsis: The AI battle between China and the US is less about profits and return on investment, and more about geopolitics — national machismo, security and defence.

title.children: US, China in battle to own first artificial general intelligence

image.altText: Three women in Australian swimming outfits celebrating together.

props.synopsis: The all-conquering women's 4x100m freestyle team's victory extends a championship-winning run that began in 2018.

title.children: Australian relay teams win gold on day one of world swimming championships

image.altText: A shadowy outline of a man sitting in a chair by a window

props.synopsis: There's growing calls from the youth and domestic and family violence sector for more financial support to assist the queer, trans and gender diverse community.

title.children: Alex's boyfriend put a tracking app on his phone 'to keep him safe'

image.altText: Tadej Pogacar smiles after winning the tour de France.

props.synopsis: Tadej Pogačar is one Tour de France title away from the all-time record, but says that is not his goal, citing fears around burnout from the gruelling cycling calendar.

title.children: Burnout concerns Pogačar as history beckons after fourth Tour de France win

image.altText: Aerial shot of ship being towed out of port.

props.synopsis: Since the Tasmanian parliament was dissolved for the election, the government has been operating in "caretaker mode". Labor has accused the Liberals of breaching the rules over two decisions.

title.children: Tasmanian Liberals accused of breaching caretaker conventions

image.altText: AI child abuse phone generic

props.synopsis: MP Kate Chaney is set to introduce a bill to criminalise the use of AI tools purpose-built to create child sexual abuse material, with the independent saying the urgent issue cannot wait for the government's wider response to artificial intelligence.

title.children: Laws to criminalise AI child abuse apps to be introduced to parliament

image.altText: Documents with NT police logo in top right corner alongside paper clip

props.synopsis: Around 1.5 per cent of Northern Territory children aged between 10 and 17 spent time in police watch houses over a six-month period.

title.children: 'It makes me cry': Hundreds of Indigenous kids held in NT watch houses over six months

image.altText: A police car outside National Zoo and Aquarium.

props.synopsis: Jude Wijesinghe pleads guilty to the stabbing murder of Tshewang Choden at the National Zoo and Aquarium in December 2023.

title.children: 'Prettiest name in the world': Man's text to co-worker before her murder

image.altText: Several people inspect a derailed train in the bush.

props.synopsis: The regional passenger train had about 100 people on board at the time of the crash.

title.children: Train derailment kills at least three people in Germany

image.altText: A man and woman stand in front of a house and a real estate "sold" sign.

props.synopsis: Coastal towns in central Queensland are being inundated with people wanting to move in, but councils are unable to process development applications fast enough to cater for demand.

title.children: Coastal growth sees house prices soar and town planning issues mount

image.altText: Four people seated at a table look at a camera smiling.

props.synopsis: Multiple fatal crashes involving Indonesian drivers on work and holiday visas prompt calls for better support inexperienced drivers who need transport to work in regional areas.

title.children: Calls for Australia to tighten overseas drivers licence rules

image.altText: A dark grey cockatoo on a tree branch covered in snow.

props.synopsis: Gang-gang cockatoos like cool weather, but freezing conditions are putting them at risk this winter, as volunteers race to save grounded birds in the Victorian Alps.

title.children: Endangered cockatoos frozen, trapped by cold snap in Victorian Alps

image.altText: An excavator sits atop a pile of woodchips.

props.synopsis: A former golf course in inner-Melbourne is being transformed into what the council describes as a biodiversity refuge of wetlands and wildflower meadows, but residents fear the removal of native trees is undermining the project's aims.

title.children: 'Ham-fisted' tree removal sparks concerns as golf course transformed

image.altText: A man smiles as he holds his arms in the air.

props.synopsis: Simon "Simmo" Braun has visited every Lifeblood centre in the country, aiming to save lives and set a new blood donation record.

title.children: Dad rallies Australians to set new blood donation record

image.altText: Lucy Bronze holds the Euros trophy

props.synopsis: England goes back-to-back at the women's Euro, beating World Cup winners Spain 3-1 in a penalty shootout, despite defender Lucy Bronze admitting post-match that she had been playing on a broken leg throughout.

title.children: 'Not human': England defender plays entire tournament on broken leg
